page.title: 09GLENIFFER HOME
page.content: Gleniffer Home is more than 100 years old and Mrs. McKnight has worked there for 24 years. We asked her some questions about the place. She told us that the people there are all over 70 years old, but only one is disabled, the rest can get around unaided. There are 31 beds in the home, but only 30 patients at the moment. Two of the residents are Roman Catholics and the chaplain, a Fr. Carroll visits them once a week. The home provides employment for a number of people. There are 8 day nurses, 5 on nights, 1 matron in charge, 7 domestic staff, 2 cooks, 1 doctor and a gardener. Mrs. McKnight enjoys her work even though she has to wash, serve meals, make beds, bathe the old and wash their hair if they can't manage. She does not live on the premises, but on Glasgow Road, Paisley
